description:
5th-grader Laura Haruna owns a hamster, and his name is Hamtaro. After moving into a new town, Hamtaro finds that he's in the company of lots of different hamsters, making up a group of hamster friends that go on crazy adventures through the city. Before they save Laura and other humans from nasty predicaments, however, they have to learn how to save themselves.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Primarily Animal Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed animal or animal-like characters.

node.description: Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

Creator of the television series Hamtaro. 

Originally created Hamtaro as a comic book, first published in 1997, and was then adapted to an anime in 2000.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/福冨博) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshi_Fukutomi)

Originating from [Shin-Ei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/247/)

Married to animator [Kazuko Fukutomi](https://anilist.co/staff/157057/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

Shimada graduated from the Department of Education at Waseda University. In 1981, when she was in her third university year, she learned that Toei Douga was recruiting new employees and took an exam to become a trainee director. The studio's policy at the time was not to employ women as directors, and although she scored top marks in the exam, she was encouraged to try writing screenplays instead. She made her debut with a script for episode 42 of Dr. Slump: Arale-chan, which was aired on 10 February 1982. After that, she established a successful career in scriptwriting. On 15 December 2017, she passed away at age 58 from an undisclosed disease.
He is a singer, composer and guitarist.

Giorgio Vincenzo Vanni is an Italian singer and song-writer.  Vanni is well known for performing theme songs of Italian dubs of Japanese and American animated TV series.   The dubbed Italian songs he sings usually are not covers of the Japanese songs but tend to be newly written songs for the Italian dub of the anime.   (Source: Wikipedia)

An Italian singer and actress. She sings for television and animation series, and has recorded numerous albums, selling nearly 7 million copies. In Italy, she is also known for singing the Italian version of the theme song of many anime, including One Piece, Doraemon, Attacker YOU! ("Mila e Shiro" in Italian), Sailor Moon and Captain Tsubasa ("Holly e Benji" in Italian).
This is a French voice actress mainly known for her job on Card Captor Sakura (Sakura), Haibane Renmei (Rakka) or Ghost in the Shell (Tachikomas).
**Katrine Louise Blomstrand** is a Norwegian voice actor and dubbing instructor.
